contentList.content: Martial Arts

Attacks with <LSTag Tooltip="MonkWeapon">Monk Weapons</LSTag> and unarmed attacks deal [1], unless their normal damage is higher and scale with your <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> instead of your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> if your Dexterity is higher. In addition, you can make <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="CL_Target_OneDnD_MartialArts_UnarmedStrikeBonus">Unarmed Strikes</LSTag> as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>.

Level 1: 1d6.
Level 5: 1d8.
Level 11: 1d10.
Level 17: 1d12.
Martial Arts: Dextrous Attacks

Attacks with <LSTag Tooltip="MonkWeapon">Monk Weapons</LSTag> and unarmed attacks scale with your <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> instead of your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> if your Dexterity is higher.
Martial Arts: Unarmed Strikes

You can make <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="CL_Target_OneDnD_MartialArts_UnarmedStrike_BonusAction">Unarmed Strikes</LSTag> as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>.
Martial Arts: Unarmed Strike
Swiftly unarmed strike a target.
Swiftly unarmed strike a target as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>.
Monk’s Focus

Your self-discipline and martial training allow you to harness a well of extraordinary energy within yourself. You can spend <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="KiPoint">these points</LSTag> to fuel advanced monk techniques.

You start knowing three such features: <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="CL_Target_OneDnD_FlurryOfBlows_FirstStrike">Flurry of Blows</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="CL_Shout_OneDnD_PatientDefence">Patient Defence</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="CL_Shout_OneDnD_StepOfTheWind">Step of the Wind</LSTag>.
Focus Points: 2
Focus Point(s)
Your self-discipline and martial training allow you to harness a well of extraordinary energy within yourself. You can spend Focus Points to fuel advanced monk techniques.
Additional Focus Point
You gain an additional <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="KiPoint">Focus Point</LSTag> to fuel your monk techniques.
Flurry of Blows
Make two Unarmed Strikes as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>.
Flurry of Blows: Follow Up Strike
Follow up with another Unarmed Strike.
Patient Defence: Disengage
Patient Defence

Focusing on avoiding attacks.

Can move without provoking Opportunity Attacks. Attack Rolls against the affected entity have Disadvantage, and the entity has Advantage on Dexterity Saving Throws.
Step of the Wind: Dash
Step of the Wind

Focusing on speed.

Movement speed is doubled. Can move without provoking Opportunity Attacks. Jump no longer requires a bonus action and the distance is doubled.
Deflect Attacks

Use your reaction to reduce the damage from a weapon attack by 1d10 + your Dexterity Modifier + your monk level.

If the damage is reduced to 0, you use a Focus Point to Deflect the Attack.
You can only reduce damage from the attack - any additional effects can't be negated.
Deflect Attack

Reduce the damage from a weapon attack by 1d10 + your Dexterity Modifier + your monk level.

If the damage is reduced to 0, you use a Focus Point to Deflect the Attack.
Use your reflexes to redirect a weapon attack back at your attacker.
Redirect a weapon attack back at your attacker.
